data.title: NAIS
data.text:
2024-25 DASL Data Entry is Open! Enter Foundation Data by October 18

Have questions? Get tips and key information for data entry, watch video tutorials, and register for webinars that cover different stages of the 2024-2025 DASL data entry process.

Go to DASL

The Benefit of Leadership Coaching for School Heads

A head-turned-leadership coach explains how coaching can help school heads develop new skills and tools to navigate today's challenges and become more effective leaders.

Read More

Legal Tip of the Week: Physical Safety

There are so many things to consider when evaluating your school’s physical security and the various threats out there. Find out what to consider when creating an emergency operations plan and what resources can help your school in this process.

Read More

Resources for Educators in an Election Season

This election season, educators likely will manage challenging conversations and be called on to model and teach civil discourse. NAIS has compiled this list of resources to help your school.

Learn More

Member Voices Podcast: Transitioning to Headship

Maria Croley Madden, who is going into her second year as head of St. Martin's Episcopal School (GA), talks about the transition to headship and how she’s preparing for Year 2.

Get the Podcast

A Sacred Journey: Leadership Lessons from a Long-Term School Head

"Between moments of heart-wrenching difficulty, there will be rushes of joy and satisfaction that remind you that we are doing the best, most world-changing, heart-swelling work there is."

Read More

2023–2024 State of Independent School Governance, Part 1

This comprehensive look at industry-wide standards will help you contextualize your school's governance practices and learn about best practices in governance. Get tips, guidance, and key data.

Read More

Resources for Educators About the Conflict in the Middle East

We hope these resources can help school leaders and educators as they support their communities, restore a sense of security, guide students in understanding the conflict, and manage complex conversations.

Read More
